title: Can't buy Champion with IP
body: I have 3383 IP right now but I can't buy any champion that cost 3150 IP or more. There isn't even a button when I tried to buy those champion. It say I don't have enough "Not enough RP/IP" but on the top right corner it say I have more than enough IP to buy the champion. So far it is only allowing me to buy champion under 1350 IP. This happen when I went to store recently, It been happening for a few days now.

replies.body: Still buging in 2017!
Didn't realized it was still bugging.

We're currently tracking this issue to see what specifically is causing it, but in the meantime, I'd like you to try a workaround that has been resolving this for some players. Close League out entirely, then launch League, but don't log in. You can access the *Legacy Client* from the login screen, as shown below:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/215576628/Launch-Legacy-Client.jpg

Hit that button, then log in and head to the store. Try making a purchase from this client and let me know if this worked and if it made any changes in your ability to make purchases in the Beta Client as well.
I used this trick and it worked. Thank you so much :)

Has been in since the whole time I was testing several months ago and is an still active bug.  To people commenting the different champion prices, I find it shorts you about 300 IP.  Is more so related to your IP total, and not the champion price.  I have not noticed it being associated with time, but i play daily so could not say if it would correct the balance after a while.  

For those of you who are like me and cannot be bothered to keep the legacy client updated as well as the new client, I just stay in the mindset of having 300 less IP than it shows.  Those are about the only two options until the bug is squashed. 

Good luck in your games!

FYI this is still or is again a problem 19 days later in new client.
